conclusion: Principles of shadow formation are affected by the position of the light source relative to the objects.
The image shows four shadows labeled A, B, C, and D cast by objects above the slabs.
The light source is currently positioned to cast shadows in a specific direction and size.
When the light source moves, the direction and length of the shadows will change.
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows will shift to the right and potentially become longer or shorter depending on the angle of the light.
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will shift to the left and similarly change in length.
Shadow A is cast by an object that seems to be tall and narrow.
Moving the light source to the back left will cause shadow A to shift to the right and potentially elongate.
Moving the light source to the back right will cause shadow A to shift to the left and may shorten or elongate depending on the light angle.
Shadow B is likely cast by a smaller, possibly circular object.
Moving the light source to the back left will shift shadow B to the right and may change its shape slightly.
Moving the light source to the back right will shift shadow B to the left, with similar potential changes in shape.
Shadow C appears to be cast by a larger, flat object.
Moving the light source to the back left will cause shadow C to shift to the right and possibly elongate.
Moving the light source to the back right will cause shadow C to shift to the left and change in length.
Shadow D is cast by an object that seems to be elevated above the ground.
Moving the light source to the back left will shift shadow D to the right and may elongate it.
Moving the light source to the back right will shift shadow D to the left and alter its length.
When the light source moves to the back left, all shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift to the right. Their lengths may increase or decrease depending on the angle of the light relative to the objects.
When the light source moves to the back right, all shadows will shift to the left. Similarly, their lengths may change based on the light angle.
